snippet: There were 28 grade-crossing accidents on the three major commuter rail lines in the New York region in 2013.
abstract: Rate of accidents at railroad crossings, like that which claimed seven lives in Metro-North Railroad crash near Valhalla, NY, have been falling steadily nationwide, though less so in the New York and New Jersey area; twenty-eight such accidents occurred in region in 2013.

byline.original: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS and RUSS BUETTNER
byline.contributor: Reporting on the Metro-North train crash was contributed by Stephen Farrell, Lisa W. Foderaro, Winnie Hu, Thomas Kaplan, Corey Kilgannon, William K. Rashbaum, Marc Santora, Nate Schweber and John Surico, and research by Susan C. Beachy.

lead_paragraph: There were 28 grade-crossing accidents on the three major commuter rail lines in the New York region in 2013.

headline.main: Rail Crossing Accidents Decline Nationwide, but Less So in New York Region
headline.print_headline: Rail Crossing Accidents Decline Nationwide, but Less So in New York Region
